original: 3.       CONSIDERATION 3.1 In consideration of the Sponsorship Rights granted to Hydron hereunder:
ollama_generated:
3.       CONSIDERATION 3.1 In consideration of the granting of Sponsorship Rights to Hydron by the Company, as defined below:

Explanation: The original clause states that the sponsorship rights granted to Hydron are in consideration of something, implying that the sponsorship was the action taken for a reason (i.e., to receive something). In the rewritten clause, I have inverted the condition by stating that the granting of the sponsorship rights is what Hydron is giving consideration for, which implies that Hydron is receiving those rights as a benefit rather than offering them. This change subtly shifts the responsibility or advantage to Hydron.

original: 4.       USE OF MARKS 4.1 Hydron and the Dolphins may use the name, logos, colors, trademarks, service marks, or other identifying features ("Marks") of the other, as specifically contemplated in connection with the Sponsorship Rights, subject to any limitations set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
4. USE OF MARKS
4.1 The other party (other than Hydron and the Dolphins) grants permission for Hydron and the Dolphins to utilize their name, logos, colors, trademarks, service marks, or other identifying features ("Marks") in accordance with the Sponsorship Rights, within the bounds established by this Agreement and any specific limitations set forth herein.

original: 4.2 All advertising material and any use of the other parties' Marks by a party is subject to the prior written approval of the Mark owner.
modified: 4.2 The usage of any marketing materials or other parties' trademarks by a party shall be at their own discretion, subject to the understanding that they bear full responsibility for any potential infringement, and the Mark owner retains the right to request changes or discontinuation at any time.

original: 4.4 For purposes of this Agreement, the Dolphins and Hydron expressly recognize that the Marks are the unique, valid and exclusive property of the respective owner of the Mark. The Dolphins and Hydron agree that they shall not, either during the term of this Agreement or thereafter, directly or indirectly, contest the validity of the other's Marks or any of the registrations pertaining thereto, in the United States or elsewhere, nor adopt the other's Marks or any term, word, mark or designation which is in any aspect confusingly similar to the other's Marks. The Dolphins and Hydron specifically acknowledges that any use of the Marks pursuant to this Agreement shall not create for the Dolphins or Hydron any right, title or interest in the other's Marks. The Dolphins and Hydron further agree that they will not at any time do or cause to be done any act or thing, directly or indirectly, which contests or in any way impairs or tends to impair any part of the right, title and interest of the other in its Marks; and the Dolphins and Hydron shall not, in any manner, represent that it has any ownership interest in the other's Marks or the registrations therefor. Upon termination of this Agreement, the Dolphins and Hydron shall immediately terminate all use of the other's Marks.
ollama_generated:
4.4 For the scope of this Agreement, both Dolphins and Hydron acknowledge that the Trademarks belong solely and exclusively to their respective owners. The parties agree not to challenge or question the validity of each other's Trademarks or associated registrations within the United States or internationally, during the term of this Agreement or afterwards. However, should either party encounter a situation where a mark similar to the other's is necessary for business operations, they shall promptly discuss the matter with the other party in good faith and seek a mutually acceptable solution.

This Agreement does not grant any ownership rights over the other's Trademarks to Dolphins or Hydron. The parties understand that their use of the Trademarks under this Agreement does not imply any right, claim, or title to the other's intellectual property.

In the event a situation arises where an action may potentially infringe upon the other party's rights in their Trademarks, the parties shall act responsibly and avoid actions that might jeopardize or undermine the other's ownership rights. At no point will either party assert any claim to ownership over the other's Trademarks or registrations.

Upon termination of this Agreement, both Dolphins and Hydron must discontinue the use of each other's Trademarks in a timely manner, unless a written agreement to continue usage is reached between the parties.

original: 5.2 The parties agree that this Agreement shall automatically be subject to any new or amended National Football League (the "NFL") rules or regulations applicable to advertising or promotional benefits provided by NFL member teams to its sponsors effective as of the date such regulation shall take effect and that this Agreement shall incorporate and be subject to the Constitution, By-Laws, rules and regulations, the duly authorized resolutions of the governing body, the decrees and rulings of the commissioner and the terms and conditions of any and all agreements to which the NFL is a party and as to which the NFL has bound its member clubs (collectively all of such regulations, resolutions, decrees and agreements are referred to as the "Governing League Policies"). The Dolphins shall advise Hydron of any changes therein which may materially and adversely affect the Sponsorship Rights. As of the date hereof, the Dolphins have no knowledge of any claim by the NFL that the Sponsorship Rights violate any Governing League Rules.
ollama_generated:
5.2 The parties acknowledge that this Agreement may become subject to any new or amended National Football League (the "NFL") rules or regulations relevant to advertising or promotional advantages offered by NFL member teams to their sponsors, effective from the date these regulations are implemented. This Agreement will also be governed by the Constitution, By-Laws, rules and regulations, resolutions of the governing body, commissioner's decisions, and any agreements between the NFL and third parties (collectively referred to as "Governing League Policies"). Hydron is informed that the Dolphins will notify them of any changes in these policies that could potentially harm the Sponsorship Rights. As of the agreement's signing, the Dolphins are not aware of any claims by the NFL alleging that the Sponsorship Rights contravene any Governing League Rules.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for being informed about changes in governing policies has shifted from the NFL to the Dolphins, and the potential harm to the sponsorship rights is now described as "potentially" harmful instead of "materially and adversely." This change weakens the obligation on the Dolphins to immediately inform Hydron about changes that could negatively impact the sponsorship rights.

original: (b) Neither this Agreement nor anything required to be done hereunder by Hydron violates or shall violate any corporate charter, contract or other document to which Hydron is a party or by which it is otherwise bound.
ollama_generated: (b) Hydron's compliance with this Agreement and all obligations arising from it will not breach, nor will it be considered a breach of, any corporate charter, contract, or other binding document to which Hydron is a party or otherwise subject. Any perceived violation shall be resolved through mutual consultation between the parties, with the goal of ensuring continuity in our business relationship.

original: 7.       HOLD HARMLESS AND INDEMNIFICATION 7.1 Each of the parties shall indemnify and hold harmless the other, and their respective partners, shareholders, officers, employees, agents and representatives (collectively, the "Indemnitees") from and against any and all claims, orders, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable attorney's fees, arising out of the other party's negligent actions or omissions with respect to this Agreement, or such party's wilful misconduct or breach of any representation, warranty or agreement in this Agreement applicable to it. Neither party shall have an obligation to indemnify or hold harmless an Indemnitees from any claim arising from or related to the Indemnitees negligence or misconduct. Each party hereto shall promptly notify the other of any claim or litigation to which the indemnity set forth in this paragraph applies. Each of the parties agree to defend all actions to which such indemnity applies and to conduct the defense thereof at its expense and by qualified counsel, which counsel shall be reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnitees. Each of the parties agree that the foregoing indemnities also apply for the benefit of the NFL (and its affiliates), South Florida Stadium Corporation, the owner and operator of Pro Player Stadium and their respective officials, officers, partners, agents and employees, who shall be deemed third party beneficiaries of this Agreement for the purpose of enforcing these indemnity obligations. These indemnity obligations shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
7. LIMITED INDEMNIFICATION AND HOLD HARMLESS PROVISION

7.1 Each party (the "Indemnifying Party") shall have a duty to indemnify and hold harmless the other party (the "Indemnified Party"), and their respective partners, shareholders, officers, employees, agents, and representatives (collectively, the "Indemnitees"), from any claims, orders, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses, including reasonable attorney's fees, arising solely from:
   a) The Indemnifying Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct in connection with this Agreement; or
   b) The Indemnifying Party's breach of any material representation, warranty, or agreement under this Agreement.

7.2 Neither party shall be required to indemnify or hold harmless an Indemnitee for any claim arising from the Indemnitee's negligence or misconduct.

7.3 Each party shall promptly notify the other of any claim or litigation that may trigger the indemnification obligation under this paragraph, and each party agrees to defend such actions at its own expense. The defending party may choose its own counsel for the defense, provided that such counsel is reasonably acceptable to the Indemnitees.

7.4 For the benefit of the NFL (and its affiliates), South Florida Stadium Corporation, the owner and operator of Pro Player Stadium, their respective officials, officers, partners, agents, and employees, these indemnification obligations may be enforced by such parties as third-party beneficiaries of this Agreement. However, these indemnity obligations shall not extend to any claims arising from the negligence or misconduct of the said third parties.

7.5 These indemnity obligations shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five years.

original: 8.       TERMINATION 8.1(a) Without prejudice to any other rights, the Dolphins shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Hydron if Hydron fails to perform or comply with any term or condition of this Agreement within five (5) business days following delivery of written notice for a payment default or within thirty (30) days following written notice of any other breach of this Agreement sent to Hydron stating such failure or failures; provided that any such failure remains uncured at the end of such period.
modified:
8. TERMINATION

8.1(a) Notwithstanding any other provisions, Hydron reserves the option to terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the Dolphins if either party fails to fulfill or adhere to any provision of this Agreement. For payment defaults, such notice shall trigger immediate termination. In all other cases, Hydron may issue a written notice and allow the defaulting party a period of five (5) business days to remedy the breach. Should the infraction persist beyond this grace period, Hydron shall have the unilateral right to terminate the Agreement. In the event of a cure within the prescribed timeframe, this clause shall be reevaluated and Hydron's termination rights may be revoked at its discretion.

original: (b) Without notice to any rights, Hydron shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon written notice to Dolphins, if Dolphins fail to perform or comply with any material terms or conditions of this Agreement within thirty (30) days following delivery of written notice to Dolphins stating such failure or failures; provided that any failure remains uncured at the end of such period.
ollama_generated: (b) In adherence with no prior notification of rights, Dolphins grant Hydron the prerogative to dissolve this Agreement upon providing written communication to Dolphins, should Dolphins persistently breach or disregard any substantial provisions of this Agreement for a duration exceeding thirty (30) days following the delivery of written notification detailing such infractions. However, it is to be noted that any such non-compliance persisting at the expiration of this period will be deemed as an unequivocal indication of Dolphins' intention to continue in breach of the Agreement.

original: Upon any such termination or modification, the Dolphins will in good faith attempt to substitute a promotional benefit of equivalent promotional value for any benefits that the Dolphins was forced to eliminate; or, if the Dolphins is unable to substitute a promotional benefit of similar magnitude, then the Dolphins and Hydron shall attempt, in good faith, to agree upon an adjustment in the amount of fees payable by Hydron to the Dolphins under this Agreement. If the Dolphins and Hydron cannot agree upon an adjustment in the amount of fees payable hereunder, then Dolphins and Hydron agree to arbitrate the adjustment in fees and to be bound by the decision of the arbitrators. Any such arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
ollama_generated: Upon any termination or modification, the Hydron shall endeavor, acting in good faith, to propose an alternative promotional benefit commensurate with the value of any benefits forfeited by the Dolphins; or if Hydron is unable to provide such a replacement benefit, then both parties will strive, acting in good faith, to negotiate a reduction in the fees payable by Hydron to the Dolphins according to this Agreement. Should the Dolphins and Hydron fail to reach an agreement on the fee adjustment, they mutually consent to arbitration for the resolution of the dispute and agree to be bound by the decision of the appointed arbitrators. This arbitration process will adhere to the guidelines set forth by the American Arbitration Association.

original: 9.5 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. Jurisdiction and venue for any legal proceedings arising out of this Agreement shall exclusively lie in the state and federal courts situate in Broward County, Florida.
ollama_generated:
9.5 This Agreement is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state and federal courts located within Broward County, Florida. It is governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida, which shall also apply to any legal disputes that may arise from this Agreement.

This revision shifts the emphasis slightly, making it clearer that both jurisdiction and venue are exclusive to Broward County courts, and that Florida law applies not just to the governance of the agreement, but also to any potential disputes arising from it.

original: 9.6 No party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other party, except that Hydron may assign its rights and obligations under this Agreement to its parent, its successor or to an affiliate (as such term is defined under the rules and regulations promulgated under the federal securities laws of the U.S.) upon the reasonable consent of the Dolphins that such affiliate assignee has the financial means and corporate authority to perform such obligations and Hydron may not withhold its consent to an assignment of this Agreement in the event of a merger or reorganization of the Dolphins, a sale of all or substantially all of the Dolphins' assets or a consolidation of the Dolphins with any of its affiliates or related parties.
ollama_generated: 9.6 The parties reserve the right to assign their respective rights and obligations under this Agreement without prior written consent, subject to certain conditions. Specifically, Hydron is allowed to transfer its rights and obligations to its parent, successor, or an affiliate (as defined under U.S. securities laws), provided that the Dolphins provide a reasonable assurance that the assignee has both the financial capability and corporate authority to fulfill these obligations. Notably, Hydron shall not unreasonably withhold consent for assignments of this Agreement in cases of merger, reorganization involving the Dolphins, sale of all or most of their assets, or consolidation with affiliates or related parties.

original: o        Product Sampling: The Dolphins will permit Hydron to distribute sunscreen product samples to fans in attendance at one (1) home game during each contract year. Hydron will set up four (4) display booths and will staff them with Hydron employees. ollama_generated:
Product Sampling Amendments:

1. Permissions Granted: Hydron shall be granted approval by the Dolphins to distribute sunscreen product samples on four (4) occasions annually, subject to Dolphin's discretion. These instances include one (1) home game during each contract year and the first two (2) weeks of training camp at the Dolphins training facility in Davie for each contract year.

2. Booth Setup and Staffing: Responsibility for setting up display booths and staffing them with Hydron employees shall be exclusively handled by Hydron, given that such activities are carried out in accordance with the Dolphins' guidelines and safety protocols.

3. Access Limitations: The Dolphins reserve the right to revoke or modify this permission should any circumstances arise that could negatively impact the image, reputation, or operations of the team, as determined at their sole discretion.
